info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 17 at 11:38AM CDT until June 21 at 1:19PM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Wichita KS has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas...
Slate Creek At Wellington affecting Sumner and Cowley Counties.
Little Arkansas River At Alta Mills affecting Harvey and Reno Counties.
Cottonwood River near Florence affecting Marion County.
Whitewater River at Towanda affecting Butler County.
Little Arkansas River Near Halstead affecting Harvey County.
Whitewater River at Augusta affecting Cowley and Butler Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record.
* WHERE...Little Arkansas River near Halstead.
* WHEN...From Wednesday evening to early Saturday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Riverside Park floods north of the river. Flood waters may begin to encroach on K89 just north of the river bridge along with a trailer park and a few residences north of Halstead. Expect field flooding on both sides of Halstead Road north of the flood gates. More field flooding occurs north of Highway 50 on the east bank of the river. Just southeast of the city, SW 48th St becomes impassable from Hertzler Rd to Essex Heights.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to a crest of 26.1 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 1145 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING TO EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON
